subject: Re: [PATCH 2/3] btrfs: don't allow log trees to consume global reserve or overcommit metadata

reviews.author: fdmanana (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised a concern about the patch not addressing all possible reasons for using BTRFS_RESERVE_NO_FLUSH, and requested an update to the comment in btrfs/space-info.h.

reviews.author: Leo Martins
reviews.summary: Reviewer Leo Martins agrees with the patch, suggesting an alternative approach using an allowlist/blocklist for global block reserve usage, but finds that the log tree's fallback behavior makes it unique.

reviews.author: Qu Wenruo
reviews.summary: Reviewer Qu Wenruo questioned the 256MiB requirement for metadata bg allocation, suggesting it might be due to unallocated space not being included in the space dump.
